items.sentence: Once all the money's run out, we'll have to give up.
I don't know why Tom doesn't want to talk with Mary.
You're glad that that's going to happen, aren't you?
You're going to have to stop doing that, aren't you?
You're much heavier than you used to be, aren't you?
You're much thinner than you used to be, aren't you?
You're the one responsible for all this, aren't you?
You're the one who should be doing that, aren't you?
You're the only person that can do this, aren't you?
This isn't the first time Tom has made that mistake.
Sometimes it seems like all you care about is money.
Do you have any idea how long it took me to do this?
It makes Tom happy when he makes other people happy.
Tom turned around and saw someone was following him.
Tom is honest. That's one of the reasons I like him.
There are still many things that need to be changed.
Why didn't you tell me that Tom was in the hospital?
Tom laughed even though what Mary said wasn't funny.
Tom asked Mary's father for permission to marry her.
It took us a long time to figure out how to do that.
